attributes.text: Record my starting X and Y locations
Constraints - my X and Y locations
Change Image - Show my dead image
Change Attribute - Move me down off screen
Only do collisions if I'm alive
Allow me to jump through special platforms from below
This rule allows me to pass through 'special' platforms from below while I'm jumping.
Turn off collisions when I'm dead

New addition in v1.1 below:
These two behaviors handle the Non-Wall-Jumping actor. The player will collide with this actor but the jumps will not be reset so the player will not be able to wall-jump on this platform. Also if you use it as a floor platform instead of a wall it will be a sort of 'trap' where they cannot jump while on it (after their first jump).
Collide with the Platform 2 - NWJ: But DO NOT reset my jumping!
Change Attribute - Flag that I'm no longer jumping/in the air
Change Attribute - Give me the Double Jump!
Change Attribute - Immediately force update of totalJumps
This rule triggers the star power up. To allow more than 2 jumps increase the number of 'totalJumps' above as needed.
Flag that I've touched the ground
Change Attribute - Flag that I'm no longer jumping/in the air
Change Attribute - reset my jumpCount so I can jump again
Destory me when I hit 'player death'

Addition to v1.1:
Added the rule below to pop/bounce the player up after they crush and enemy.
Pop the Player Up After Crushing an Enemy
Change Attribute - Turn the Pop Off
Change Attribute - Move me up. To increase or decrease the bounce of the spring, adjust the number below.
Change Attribute - Flat that I'm jumping/in the air
Timer - Adjust the time below to show the activated spring longer/shorter.
Check if I'm on a Slider and 'stick' me to it IF i'm not walking

This rule 'sticks' the player to the 'slider' platforms. If you add more slider platforms and additions Game Level Attributes sliderOffsetX-2, sliderOffsetX-3, etc. You'll need to add additional copies of this rule and update the the two Change Attribute Behaviors below with the correct sliderOffset Attributes.
Change Attribute - set my X offset for this slider
Constrain Attribute - set my X position based on the X offset
Jumping Move Rules - Allow me to change directions in mid-air
Change Attribute - face me to the right
Change Attribute - Move me to the right
Change Attribute - Face me to the left
Change Attribute - Move me to the left

This rule with either stop all motion if no key or onscreen button is pressed or perform the appropriate movement.
Check the OTHERWISE section
Change Attribute - Stop my side to side motion
Only allow me to move and animate if I'm alive
Animate me or show my jumping/dead image
Zombie 6_00001 Zombie 6_00002 Zombie 6_00003 Zombie 6_00004 Zombie 6_00005 Zombie 6_00006
Show correct image if the player is jumping
Show correct image if the player is dead
Change Attribute - Make sure I'm looking to the right
Change Attribute - choose my walking speed
Change Attribute - Make sure I'm looking to the left
Change Attribute - Choose my walking speed
only allow the jump if I have a jump
Change Attribute - reduce my jump count by 1
Change Attribute - Flag jumping as true

Addition for v1.1:
The Change Attribute below handles the strength/height of the players jump. I've abstracted the value out to a new Actor Level Attribute called jumpStrength so it can easily be edited if desired. For v1.1 I've increased the height of the jump slightly from 400 up to 415. Some users were having a 'glitch' when jumping through the special platform. The extra height of the jump solves the issue by making sure the player passes completely through the platform. If you experience any glitches using the special platform try adjusting it's height above the player and/or the jumpStrength.
Change Attribute - Set my jumping height
Timer - After I fade out go to the next scene/level
Change Scene - Go to the next level
